hero.heading: Orchestrate, deploy, and manage containers, binaries, and batch jobs in the cloud or on-prem

overview.heading: What is Nomad?
overview.body: A simple and flexible scheduler and orchestrator to deploy and manage containers and non-containerized applications across on-prem and clouds at scale

get_started.heading: Getting Started
get_started.body: Learn how to use Nomad to schedule and orchestrate workloads.

tutorialCards.description:
Deploy applications to multiple federated Nomad clusters with configurable
rollout and rollback strategies.
tutorialCards.heading: Multi-region deployments

tutorialCards.description: Use Nomad to orchestrate edge workloads. Schedule a demo application on the  edge, using Nomad's native service discovery to connect edge services.  Simulate unstable edge connections to learn how Nomad gracefully handles  disconnected clients.
tutorialCards.heading: Schedule edge Services with native service discovery

tutorialCards.description: Deploy an Application Load Balancer on AWS to allow external Internet traffic to your internally load balanced applications running in Nomad.
tutorialCards.heading: Managing external traffic with application load balancing

cards.heading: Deploy and Manage Jobs
cards.body: Learn the fundamentals of expressing your workload as Nomad jobs.

cards.heading: Parameterized Jobs
cards.body: Nomad parameterized jobs enable dynamic runtime behaviors from a single job specification.

cards.heading: Nomad Pack
cards.body: Create and re-use existing job templates with Nomad Pack.

cards.heading: Integrate Consul
cards.body: Learn to secure jobs and add Consul health checking, service discovery, and service mesh capabilities.

cards.heading: Integrate Vault
cards.body: Configure the Nomad secrets engine in Vault and use Vault to obtain secrets for workloads.

cards.heading: Nomad Enterprise
cards.body: Learn about Nomad Enterprise features and how to use them at scale.

cards.heading: Secure Nomad with Access Control
cards.body: Learn to configure a Nomad cluster for ACLs, author your first policy, and grant a token based on it.

cards.heading: Enable Transport Encryption for Nomad
cards.body: Encrypt Nomad's intercluster trafficâ€”UDP gossip and TCP API/RPC traffic.

cards.heading: Job Resiliency
cards.body: Learn to keep jobs running in the event of the unexpected with local retries and node rescheduling.

cards.heading: Governance and Policy
cards.body: Operate Nomad securely in a multi-team environment with resource quotas and Sentinel integration.

cards.heading: Advanced Application Scheduling
cards.body: Learn to express placement preferences for job allocations using affinities and preemption.

cards.heading: Operating Nomad Clusters
cards.body: Learn the features operators will need to build and maintain Nomad clusters.

cards.heading: Upgrade a Cluster
cards.body: Nomad is designed to be flexible and resilient when upgrading from one Nomad version to the next.

cards.heading: Task Drivers
cards.body: Task drivers are used by Nomad clients to execute a task and provide resource isolation. Extending task drivers allows Nomad the flexibility to support a broad set of workloads.

cards.heading: External Tools
cards.body: External tools provide additional capabilities and use cases to Nomad and can sometimes be deployed as a Nomad job in your cluster.

metadata.title: Nomad by HashiCorp
metadata.description: Nomad is a highly available, distributed, data-center aware cluster and application scheduler designed to support the modern datacenter with support for long-running services, batch jobs, and much more.
